title.narrative: Support to the Women's Movement: NGOCC
Support to the Women's Movement: NGOCC

description.narrative:
Non-Governmental Gender Organisations Coordinating Council (NGOCC) i Zambia har ansökt om stöd till ett värde av 40 miljoner SEK för att implementera sin strategiska plan för perioden 2018 till 2022.
Insatsens syfte är att öka kvinnors och flickors tillgång till och kontroll över resurser, sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa, representation och politiskt deltagande på alla nivåer, och minska kvinnors utsatthet för klimatförändringar. NGOCC kommer att implementera insatsen genom sina medlemsorganisationer.
Insatsens totala budget uppgår till 97 miljoner SEK (ZMW 109 miljoner). Utav den totala budgeten så utgörs cirka 4,4 miljoner SEK av organisationens egna medel och 17,8 miljoner av medel från andra givare (WeEffect, IM Sverige, EU, CHAZ och NED). De återstående 74,8 miljonerna (SEK) är inte säkrade ännu. Cirka 23,3 miljoner SEK av den totala budgeten kommer att vidareförmedlas från NGOCC genom organisationens Basket Fund.

The Non-Governmental Gender Organisations Coordinating Council (NGOCC) in Zambia has applied to Sida for funding of 40 million SEK to implement their strategic plan "Building Solidarity for Women's Empowerment" for the period 2018 to 2022.
The intervention aims at improving women's and girls' access to and control of resources, sexual and reproductive health, representation and participation of women in governance and leadership at all levels and reducing vulnerability of women to climate change impacts and strengthening their capacity to manage natural resources. NGOCC will implement the intervention with its member organisations.
The intervention’s total budget is 97 million SEK (ZMW 109million), out of which the organisation’s own funding is approximately 4.4 million SEK (ZMW 4.9 million), other donor funding from We Effect, IM Swedish, the EU, CHAZ & NED is 17.8 million SEK (ZMW 20 million) and the remaining 74.8 million SEK (ZMW 83.9 million) not yet secured. Approximately 23.3 million SEK (ZMW 26 million) of the intervention budget will be forwarded from NGOCC to sub-grantees through its 'Basket Fund' .
To contribute to women's empowerment and gender equality in Zambia.

participating-org.narrative: NGOCC/NGO Coordinating Council/Non-Governmental Gender Organisations' Coordinating Council
NGOCC/NGO Coordinating Council/Non-Governmental Gender Organisations' Coordinating Council

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.3 - Avskaffa alla skadliga sedvänjor, såsom barnäktenskap, tidiga äktenskap och tvångsäktenskap samt kvinnlig könsstympning.
5.3 - Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

5.6 - Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights as agreed in accordance with the Programme of Action of the International Conference on Population and Development and the Beijing Platform for Action and the outcome documents of their review conferences.

5.6 - Säkerställa allmän tillgång till sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och reproduktiva rättigheter i enlighet med överenskommelserna i handlingsprogrammet från den internationella konferensen om befolkning och utveckling, Pekingplattformen samt slutdokumenten från respektive översynskonferenser.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

description.narrative: Inspite of the challenges posed by Covid-19 in 2020, NGOCC was able to continue making progress towards achievement of results. NGOCC was also able to contribute to the national Covid-19 response through it's interventions. The following are some of the results achieved under the strategic plan pillars: Women's Economic Empowerment - As a result of campaigns and advocacy on women’s access to and ownership of land, a total of 45 women accessed land and obtained Land Certificates in Kapiri and Mumbwa Districts. In addition, the Mayor of Chipata City Council pledged to ensure that 30 percent of the 400 plots that were on offer go to women while the 70 percent would be allocated fairly between women and men - A total of 3165 women received finance/credit through village banking with a total of ZMK 1,155,580 saved by women and shared out. Sexual Reproductive Health & Rights - A total of 341 girls were withdrawn from child marriages and taken back to school. 30 of these girls were in Grade Nine and passed their examinations to go to Grade Ten. - Following engagement with traditional leaders, 3 chiefs namely Kasoma-Lwela, Nsonga and Chisuka made declarations to end child marriage in their chiefdoms. 5 traditional leaders passed By-laws to prevent parents from compelling girls under the age of 18 into marriages. - 60 Men's and Boy's networks on GBV were established. Governance & Women's Leadership - Progress was made towards the efforts to increase women's participation in the 2021 presidential and general elections through the development of Women’s Coordinated Elections Campaign Strategy (CECS). Initial interventions included engagement with political parties and training of the media. - As a result of work with the media, 70 female aspiring candidates and serving Members of Parliament/ Councillors were profiled in the media. Climate Change Mitigation & Resilience - Through usage of improved cook stoves, 40% of women testified reduced time spent collecting firewood and used the saved time productively by engaging in other economic activities such as sale of vegetables. Further 1,043 girls who benefited from the project reported spending more time on school work since they are no longer being sent to collect firewood. - 200 beneficiaries were linked to SupaMoto by NGOCC for them to become sales agents of the improved cook stoves, lights and pellets
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
